38947694.review:
I cannot say enough good things about Cat Quest!  It's better written than most RPG's and the hack n' slash combat is FUN. Remember fun? It have a sweet and simple attack/dodgeroll/spam magic fighting system that is really a great time.  So many armor/weapons to find and level up (if you get a duplicate item it improves that same piece of gear, no more selling tons of trash gear at a store). The whole game is quest driven to the point of parody. I didn't encounter any bugs/crashes. Just incredible.

The artsyle is like Dont Starve meets Sproggiwood and the music is really great. I already said I liked the writing and the story is actually engaging.  It's more mature than expected (but immature as hell, so many friggin' cat puns. lol).

If you like cat jokes, cat quests and neat combat get Cat Quest.

I wasn't a big fan of the "Mew Game Plus" options they seemed a little much.  Didn't bother with them.  I also wish they had more dungeon variety and had more NPC interactions in dungeons.  99% of the time it was "go in the cave, clear the cave, oh wait I heard them escape outside lets go back outside!" type stuff.  That could have been way better implimented.

I am pretty sure you'll know if it's not for you if you wrinkle your nose at the store page on Steam; still there is a lot to love here.

	[td][i]Review in under a minute[/i][/td]
	[td][b][i]Cat Quest[/i][/b] is so unbearably cute and filled to the brim with so many kitty puns that within half an hour of play you will be looking for the nearest scratch-post so that you can do a little bit of kneading yourself. [b][i]Cat Quest[/i][/b] is also a game that is about 4 hours too long. This light and breezy aRPG from the gentle folk known as the GentleBros is a game made with a lot of heart and soul that sees you assume the mantle of a Dragonblood, and ancient type of cat warrior  whose job is to protect the world from dragons and all other manner of nasties. [b][i]Cat Quest[/i][/b] It is also a game that includes an excessive amount of padding and repetition for such a small and simple tail (meaow, yes that spelling is correct) that after the 4 hour mark I was feeling a little bit less pawsitive about it. [b][i]Cat Quest[/i][/b] takes the traditional gameplay mechanics we know from countless aRPG's but keeps them incredibly simplistic (you can see [b][i]Cat Quest[/i][/b] started life as a mobile game that got pawted over to PC). Still there is fun to be had here as you run around an open world knowns as Felingard on a mission to save your sister from the claws of a resident evil cat called Drakoth while attending to the every whim and cat-astrophe of its inhabitants. [b][i]Cat Quest[/i][/b] is sweet and purrfect for tiny drop-in-drop-out sessions and you can be guaranteed the kids will love it.[/td]

38902920.review:
[h1]Cat Quest[/h1]


[b]Kurzfassung[/b]
Cat Quest ist ein einfaches rollenspielartiges Katzenabenteuer, welches in relativ kurzer Zeit eine Geschichte erzählt. Im ersten Spieldurchgang hatte ich die Haupsttory, die Nebenaufgaben und das Besuchen aller Dungeons in ca. 10 Stunden erledigt. Danach kamen dann die neuen Spiele mit unterschiedlichen Modifikatoren wie z.B. "Stärkere Monster", "Nackte Katze" usw.  hinzu.

Insgesamt also ein einfaches und kurzweiliges Abenteuer, welches auch gut von einem jüngerem Publikum erlebt werden kann. Preis/Leistung stimmen für mich gut überein. Und als Katzenfan kommt man hier auch voll auf seine Kosten.



[b]Pro:[/b]
+ Kurzweilig
+ Simples, aber nicht langweiliges Gameplay
+ Bunte, aber knuffige Grafik
+ Katzenbezogene Dialoge bei denen ich hin und wieder schmunzeln musste
+ Musik und Sounds sind typisch und passen zur Stimmung des Spiels


[b]Con:[/b]
- Einige Errungenschaften können nur durch wiederholtes Durchspielen erlangt werden.

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

[b]Story, Charakter und Ausrüstung[/b]

Die Story ist an sich nichts Neues: Schwester wird vom Bösewicht entführt und der junge Held zieht aus, um das Geschwisterchen zu retten. Am Ende der Geschichte gibt es noch eine Wendung, aber ich will jetzt nicht zuviel verraten...

Die einzelnen Quests der Haupt- und Nebenstory sind durch den Pfeil, der einem den Weg weist, immer einfach zu finden und füllen die Welt mit Leben. Dabei sind einige etwas interessanter als andere, aber Spaß hatte ich dennoch an allen.

Die ganzen Dialoge sind voll mit Anspielungen auf Katzen und ich hatte anfangs die Befürchtung, dass es übertrieben wurde. Allerdings muss ich zugeben, dass es mich eigentlich nicht gestört hat und an manchen Stellen sogar richtig putzig ist.

Es gibt kein typisches Klassensystem wie in anderen Rollenspielen. Es gibt insgesamt 7 Zaubersprüche und diese können bis zu einer maximalen Stufe von 10 erlernt werden. Alles weitere wird über die Ausrüstung geregelt, welche Boni oder aber auch Mali auf die Eigenschaften wie Trefferpunkte, Angriff, Magie usw. geben können. Bei einem Stufenaufstieg erhöhen sich dann ebenfalls nochmal die Charaktereigenschaften um einen bestimmten Wert.

Die Ausrüstung ist so gestaltet, dass nicht das ganze Inventar voller Beute ist, sondern dass es nur eine begrenzte Auswahl an Gegenständen gibt. Sollte man in Kisten (gefunden oder bei der Schmiedin erworben) einen (zufällig ausgewählten) Gegenstand finden, den man bereits hat, wird dieser automatisch verbessert. Ausrüstung kann bis zu einer maximalen Stufe von 99 verbessert werden.
Außerdem gibt es legendäre Ausrüstung (Mut, Glauben und Willenskraft) sowie das Altmeister-Set (Altmeisterhelm, Altmeisterrüstung und Ragnarok), die ebenfalls verbessert werden kann.


[b]Grafik und Performance[/b]

Die Darstellung ist recht bunt, einfach und niedlich. Wenn man den Stil mag, gibt das Ganze ein rundes Gesamtbild ab.

Die Systemanforderungen sind niedrig und ich hatte keinerlei Probleme - keine Ruckler, Spielabstürze oder sonstiges, was das Spielvergnügen getrübt haben könnte.
Mein System: AMD Phenom II X6,  GTX660 und 8GB RAM


[b]Missionen und KI[/b]

Die Missionen sind einfach gehalten und können eigentlich nicht verfehlt werden, da ein Pfeil immer die Richtung anzeigt. An zwei Stellen in der Hauptmission müssen erst Nebenaufträge erfüllt werden, damit man in der Hauptstory weiter kommt. Aber auch dies wird einem vorher verraten, sodass man zu jeder Zeit weiß, was man machen muss. Lediglich mit den "goldenen Schatztruhen" konnte ich zu Beginn nicht viel anfangen. Dies wird aber klar, wenn man sich wirklich alles in der Welt anschaut oder den entsprechenden Guide dazu liest.

Nebenaufträge können erfüllt werden, aber dies ist keine Pflicht. Allerdings sind sie eine gute Möglichkeit, Gold und Erfahrung zu sammeln. Außerdem füllen sie die Welt mit Leben und man hat insgesamt mehr vom Spiel, wenn man diese mitmacht.

Der Kampf ist ebenfalls recht einfach. Jeder Monstertyp hat immer die selben Angriffsarten. Als Beispiel haben Füchse immer einen relativ großen Wirkungsbreich, in dem sie einen Feuerangriff starten. Fische haben hingegen nur einen kleinen Angriffsbereich. So kann es kommen, dass man von einem Rudel Magier, welche hinter Büschen stehen, schnell mal einen auf die Nase bekommt, da diese einen recht großen Angriffsbereich mit ihren magischen Attacken haben.
Wenn man allerdings ersteinmal herausgefunden hat, wie welches Monster angreift, kann man sich leicht darauf einstellen und den Kampf gegen Monster mit einer höheren Stufe wagen.


[b]Errungenschaften und Spielmodi[/b]

Einige der Errungenschaften erhält man einfach durch das Spielen der Geschichte. Einge erhält man, wenn man sich genau in der Welt umschaut und alles erkundet. Und dann gibt es welche, die man nur durch wiederholtes Spielen der Geschichte mit vorher eingestellten Modifikationen erhält. Das Bestreiten des Abenteuers mit einer Katze der Stufe 1 oder einer Katze, welche keine Ausrüstung trägt und nur mit den Boni aus den Stufenaufstiegen überleben muss, wären hier zwei Beispiele. Ebenso muss man, wenn man die Altmeisterrüstung haben will, das Spiel schon drei mal durchspielen. Will man diese dann auch noch in der Stufe verbessern, kommen weitere Durchläufe hinzu...
Dies ist für mich wirklicher ein Negativpunkt. Auch wenn das Spiel und die Geschichte niedlich sind und Spaß machen, irgendwann nach dem x-ten Mal ist es dann doch recht langweilig. Vielleicht ist es anders, wenn man nur hin und wieder ein Ründchen spielt und nicht wie ich das Spiel in relativ kurzer Zeit "durchsuchtet". Grundsätzlich sind die einzelnen Spielmodi nicht schlecht und können nochmal ein anderes Spielerlebnis vermitteln.


[b]Fazit[/b]

Cat Quest ist ein kleines, niedliches Spiel für Jung und Alt, welches mich an Spiele aus vergangenen Tagen erinnert. Man wird nicht mit Regeln und Strategie erschlagen und auch der Geschichte kann man einfach folgen. Insgesamt erhält man hier für den Preis eine ordentliche Unterhaltung für mehrere Stunden. Und für Fans von Katzen muss man hier ohnehin nichts weiter sagen. 

Von mir gibt es für dieses [b]katztastische Spiel[/b] eine klare Kaufempfehlung und ich hoffe auf ein "Dog Quest".

38883688.review:
Okay so I wanna take a minute and seriously talk about the mechanics of Cat Quest because the Gentlebros really put together a very sweet and silky setup. 

    The inventory system is clean and to the point, and I love it. There's no trash to pick up, just gear. And you'll never clutter your bag with six different Longswords -- you have one longsword, and if you pick up a second, the first one just gets stronger. The same with armour. 

    You have three slots for gear: head, chest, and weapon. When you sort your inventory by these three slots, the sorting puts the best piece at the very front so you immediately know what gives you the most benefit. This isn't perfect, though -- say you're more interested in hitting heavy with magic, or you want to build up your armour. You'll need to peruse and compair for yourself, but the best well-rounded piece is always right at the top of the list.

    Spells are also kept in the inventory, and you can train them up to level 10 by buying new ranks. You can keep four spells at the ready and it's easy to swap them out. Combat doesn't interrupt you from changing gear or spells, and if you don't want to fight you can just wander off and the mob will pretty quickly lose interest.

    Left clicking is your attack. That's it! You'll attack ahead of you, and if a mob dies while you're in the middle of murdering you'll gravitate toward the next nearest one, if there's a monster close enough.

    Right clicking gives you your magic menu, or you can use 1, 2, 3, or 4 to cast spells

    The quest system is sleek too: while you're on a side quest, the main quest is on hold. You'll get a marker to help you find where you're going (which has been helpful for me, since I'm playing the game in French and I don't always understand what I'm being told), though normally it's not really necessary. You see up front how much gold and xp you'll get in reward, but almost every quest will also give you a random piece of gear.

    I do feel like the art is a little (lot) lazy in some places: there's almost no variation in the NPCs (I can think of maybe five NPCs that have a truly unique appearance), and while the animations are smooth they're a little samey after a short while.
The music is nice, though after the first hour you'll have heard it all.

    The dungeons have a cool aspect to them: killing all the monsters inside will 'complete' the dungeon, but if you left any chests behind the dungeon will have a little chest icon over it to let you know. Many of the nifties in dungeons are only found by looking for hidden pathways, and while some dungeons do point the way to let you know, most of them don't. I am a little frustrated that most of my time in a dungeon is spent running against invisible barriers, trying to find out if there's a hidden path, but the dungeons themselves are so very short that it's not too much of a time waste.

    Monster variation is pretty cool, too, if pretty standard: there are base types of mobs and then, essentially, palette swaps of those with different moves or spells. Some mobs are boss types, and some are just really clever -- like statue hands that are animated by magic, and slam into the floor. 

    You can see where monster spell ranges are, and you have a clear visual of their attack time. The mob will flicker red or gold depending on whether they're weak or strong to a certain type of magic or to your physical attacks.

    There are no real ranged attacks in the game. Some spells reach a little bit away from you, but there are no bows, no fireballs, etc. So if you're like me and you generally prefer to be a ranged physical damager, you're a bit out of luck. :B
Money essentially doesn't matter. There's no food or potions to buy, and inns are free.

    You can spend that money at the blacksmith to try your chance at better gear, but the loot you get from doing that is random.

    In all, I've been binging the crap out of this game because the play is fun, the story is cute and entertaining (except for the immediately imperiled sister that you spend the game trying to rescue), and the system has yet to annoy me. Even when I'm in dungeons that well outlevel me I find it a fun challenge and not an irritation. Taking down lv 99 dungeons when you're sub lv50 is fun, and I suspect totally intentional. 

    I want to say this is a super solid introduction to more complex games of this type, given the wandering mobs on the overworld and the way the dungeons work, along with the quest system and the super simple but still really satisfying combat system. But even as an intro-type game, it really stands well on its own.

    And it's full of cat puns.

38859877.review:
画风Q萌的猫咪斗恶龙，恐怕真的很难想象，这个团队Gentlebros的部分成员，以前是做游戏——《真·三国无双》的，看来这年头吸猫已经成了大势所趋，连割草团队都开始涉足这蜜汁领域了（笑）。
抛开笑话不讲，《猫咪斗恶龙》本身是个十分有趣的游戏（当然，也十分优秀）。手游出身的它登录steam后也是广受好评，相比于一些传统的ARPG，《猫咪斗恶龙》的门槛更低，上手度也高。即便像我这种Action废，也能比较轻松地在七八个小时里面解决主线任务。这就意味这游戏有着不俗的可玩性，然而稍显遗憾的是，7-8小时能解决主线就意味着主线太短，但是一款独立的小游戏我们实在没办法要求更多，何况制作组还贴心地提供了挑战模式以及一系列的“真的能有人达成吗”的成就……当然，对于Act高手而言，这些成就也是相当轻松的。
再回头说说画风，整个游戏到处都充斥着Q版的猫，Q版的猫，和Q版的鹦鹉松鼠小小龙。据我所知，Gentlebros在游戏的模式上投入的时间并不是太长，但是对画风和主角的形象方面，则是改之又改，在改到“终极最后绝对打死都不改版本5”以后，他们重新使用了第一版的形象——当然这个也是个玩笑，但是他们真的改了很多次，才制作出了让大家都满意，大家都喜欢的这样一只穿盔甲的小猫的形象。所以吧，不要害怕改变，不要死守着所谓的努力成果不放，有时候及时的放弃和“变道”，更是一种勇气和智慧的表现。

38801615.review:
Vale; primer punto que quiero aclarar: Obtuve este juego de manera gratuita, ya que me lo regaló uno de mis mejores amigos por mi cumpleaños porque soy muy fan de los RPG's y de los puñeteros gatitos.

Hay una cosa principal que quiero remarcar nada más empezar: El balance entre el precio y la manera de gastar esos 13€. Ya digo que no he jugado el juego en su totalidad todavía, digo yo que debo llevar un 40% del juego completado, así que no puedo hablar sin ignorancia.

Respecto a la historia: Eso es un punto bastante en contra. Por lo que he visto, la historia es bastante monótona: Eres un gato elegido como Sangredragón y tienes que matar a otro gato que secuestró a tu hermana. Hasta ahí se sabe la historia. Las quests se hacen repetitivas, tanto las principales como las secundarias, y acabas hasta por olvidar un poco tu cometido.

Respecto a la jugabilidad: Es un poco difícil adaptarse al principio, sobre todo por el tema de la magia, y el tener que controlarlo todo entre el raton y el teclado a veces es confuso (claro, siempre puedes cambiar los controles, parezco gilipollas, ¿no? Estoy juzgando en base a lo que es el juego, no en base a lo que puedes hacer tú de ese juego).

Respecto a los gráficos: Esto es algo a lo que no suelo prestarle mucha atención, porque soy de las de "No juzgues a un libro por su portada ni a un juego por sus gráficos". Por ser un RPG, están bastante bien, no son los típicos gráficos de 8-Bit que te sueles encontrar. Y tiene gatitos.

Otros puntos a tratar: Tiene bastantes referencias y juegos de palabras con gatos, lo que hace del juego algo llevadero (me matan demasiado los gatos andaluces x'D). La banda sonora no está mal, no es de las mejores que he escuchado pero está guay. El hecho de poder tener varios tipos de equipamiento es muy positivo, ya que puedes decidir por tu cuenta si ser guerrero, mago...

Para resumir: No es de los mejores juegos que he jugado, ni de los peores, pero tiene algo que lo hace entretenido de jugar. Lo recomendaría, pero en oferta.

38792435.review:
This little game scratched the low-key holiday RPG itch for me. This is old-school ARPG level 095, not even 101. You see that guy? HIT HIM WITH YOUR SWORD UNTIL HAPPY ORBS FLY OUT! You see these caves with questionmarks? WALK INTO THEM. You can walk to any village and take a nap to save and refill health and MP, even in the middle of multiple stage quests. This saved me on more than 1 of the end-game quests (damn spike-butt adds).

My 3 caveats are small.

1 - You don't get to pick and choose the armor that is level-up'd. Devs say they want you to pick and choose armor/weapons, but this just leads to frustration. When you want to actually level up something and need to sit through the chest opening dialog AGAIN... and end up getting some worthless item upgraded from level 6 to 8.

2 - The fetch quests do require some significant back-tracking which is tedious in the mid-game. Not terrible as this just gave me more time to spam the fire spell on the thunder goats.

3 - Level markers. I'm very much a grind early and breeze through gamer. I ran through a level 10 dungeon probably 30 times to reach level 16. From then on, I was ahead of the level curve on the side-quests. However, the main quest doesn't have a level marker. I fought the red dragon at level 40... Effectively the dragon was put into a blender set to liquify. I didn't know I was twice the recommended level. Not knowing the proper level made me quite the furry monster against the main quest.

I'll finish the main quest this week and really don't feel the need to go through the mew-game+ modes. Overall 10 hours of mindless hack and slash with more if you want it. Worth it.

En el episodio de hoy de "Manqueando"... "Cat Quest"

Guau... digooo... Miau. Ha merecido la pena.

En primer lugar, cabe resaltar que esto no es un juego de esos profundos y complejos que tanto parecen gustar. Este juego es muy pero que muy simple. Y no es particularmente dificil. Pero nada de esto es malo, ya que resulta muy pero que muy entretenido.

Quizás lo único que se le pueda achacar es su duración (9 horas en mi caso). El apartado visual es colorido y muy vistoso, su historia es ridícula (para bien) y la música es perfecta para el tipo de juego que es. Creo que lo mejor que se puede decir de este juego, es que es perfecto para cualquiera.

Llevo jugando toda la vida, y naturalmente ya tengo una edad, con lo que me atraen más según que juegos. Pues este juego me parece atractivo como veterano (la diversión que proporciona compensa su simplicidad), pero tambien puede ser muy atractivo para personas más novatas. Diria que es el juego perfecto para enseñarle a jugar a un niño, o para iniciar a cualquiera.

¿¿Pero de que es?? Pues es un juego de mundo abierto (kind of), aventura rpg, y gatos. Super cuco, oyes (con voz pija).

Además, los desarroladores están por la labor y hace poco, añadieron algunas quest más, y se les ve por los foros. A ver si el juego triunfa más y se deciden a hacer la secuela contra el imperio de los perros o las ratas pirata. O por lo menos una expansión gorda :D

Pero mejor que leer analisis de aficionados (como yo), lo mejor que podeis hacer es bajaros la demo y probarlo. No creo que os arrepintais (yo no lo hice, héme aqui).

En resumen, recomendadísimo, salvo que seas uno de esos de "oh, que porqueria, no es original". Le casco un 8'5 y arreando.

En el próximo "Manqueando"... "Steamworld Heist"

Feliz año a tod@s y tal :)

38723411.review:
Cat Quest reminds me of Final Fantasy Mystic Quest, which is a game released for the SNES that was a stripped down RPG intended to introduce new players to the concepts of the Final Fantasy RPG series.  Even though Final Fantasy Mystic Quest is a game from 1992, and the idea that people need eased into the realm of RPG video games might seem silly now, back then, well, it was still silly.  Anyway.

     Cat Quest is the simplest form of ARPG.  Quests are point to point or clear this dungeon, leveling is fast, and enemies telegraph their attacks through big red AoE marks on the ground.  Honestly, if I had to pick a game that would teach a five year old how to play WoW, this would be it.  Well, I’d probably just let them play WoW, but still.  Ok, maybe not on Moonguard.

     My daughter loves Cat Quest, so maybe this sort of game is filling a need for an RPG that doesn’t have three skill trees, fifty stats, and a gear enhancement system that would make Stephen Hawking throw up his hands in despair.  Well, you know, if he could move his arms.  Maybe Cat Quest is a forerunner in a new breed of ARPG that dispenses with the complexity and depth of traditional games, ushering in a new era of accessible games!

     I sure hope not.  The thing is, the simplicity and ease of access come at a price.  Boredom.  You can only repeat the same thing so many times before it becomes tedious.  Cat Quest pushes that pretty  close to the breaking point.  There is no variety.  There are no surprises.  Once you learn the enemy patterns, of which there are maybe four, you win.

     It’s not a bad game, Cat Quest.  It does the thing it does perfectly well.  That thing just happens to be Final Fantasy Mystic Quest.  Maybe not the deepest RPG, maybe not the most fun RPG, but certainly the most accessible RPG.  Your kids will love it.  Mine does.



SNES:  Super Nintendo Entertainment System, a 16 bit video game system released in 1991 in America
RPG:  Role Playing Game, video games in which you play the role of fantasy characters, typically in which the characters increase in skill and ability through “leveling up”.
ARPG:  Action Role Playing Game, an RPG that is not turn based, but in which the action is continuous.
AoE:  Area of Effect, the area that any given spell will cover, duh.  Don’t stand in the fire.
WoW:  World of Warcraft, an online RPG that consumed years of my life.

38721459.review:
I don't usually make impulse buys. This was most definitely worth the impulse buy.

I have to say I enjoy a lot about the game, the combat, the magic system, the writing, the CATS. The only real flaw I can think of is in how you upgrade your gear; by finding the same item in chests strewn about, or chests bought from the blacksmith. I found myself gravitating towards the Squire set of equipment, which boosts armor and magic to a slightly lesser degree than just investing in one of the two normally, with the axe providing damage + magic, perfect for someone toying with the systems. The helmet and armor are working well enough, keeping up with most of my gear at around level 25 as of the time of writing, being decently common in the chests, but the Squire Axe, which I acquired early on, is still level TWO. The RNG on upgrading seems a bit silly, especially as i've left the Ranger set untouched but it's probably some of my highest leveled gear at this point.

Named gear also seems a bit... underwhelming, for the point i'm at. I got a Skull Helmet that was mildly outclassed by my Squire Helmet decently early on, and the Family Jewels sword was mostly outclassed by similar gear, just looking cool but being not very worthwhile. This problem became a bit more relevant when I got the [spoiler]Golden Key[/spoiler] at around level 35, with most of the gear from the [spoiler]Golden Chests[/spoiler] in early dungeons seeming roughly on par, if not somewhat below, most of my generic gear. 

I guess another issue would be leveling, mostly following quests. I was level 20 or so, and did about 3-4 level 20 quests, and before I knew it, I was roughly level 27 and still had a handful more regular level 20 quests to go. Doing a batch of quests in just the southern half of the continent will easily bump you to around level 30 in just a few hours, with plenty more quests to spare.

Besides that, this game is most certainly worth your time. The combat and spells are fun to play with, and I found myself greatly enjoying my time so far. I'll probably start playing again soon and see how things pan out from there.

This game is mostly a parody of Zelda, Skyrim and Final Fantasy but it is a damn good one. The combat is simplistic but fun, the story is obviously not to be taken too seriously but some of the quests were surprsingly mature in their tone. The main villain while super generic in the beginning ended up having a pretty decent backstory to his character and while the game isn't meant to be taken too seriously it has just enough depth to make the player care.

It's pretty short, my first playthrough took me 5 hours but there is loads of side quests. For the price, even without a sale it's a steal. It's one of those games that I can find myself coming back to and since it has a New Game + mode and other unlocakble things after it's beat is well worth the time put into it.

Adawwwrable! As a work of art or a cultural item, this is simply superb. It's beyond merely cute, it's kawaii. Excellent graphics, excellent music, an amusing send-up of RPG tropes, and all cat-related puns that can possibly (pawsibly?) exist.

As an RPG, it's.. meh. Possibly because it's supposed to be partially a parody, the mechanics are quite simplified and the gameplay itself starts to lose its sheen after the first 3 hours. I think pretty much all games over a certain length need to have either some complex mechanics, or some serious dramatic tension to keep the player interested, and this game does not take itself seriously enough to rely on either.

Get it on sale.

38591271.review:
Please note that the game itself is certainly pawsome, it's just that it hasn't much to offer.

The game weights only 75MB and the amount of quests is not that vast at this moment (23.12.17), but it is still good to see developers adding new (or rather mew) content. Just beware that you are buying a simple fun game that may offer about 5-10 hours of gameplay.

Positive sides:
+ Humor, characters and language (special thanks for Russian version, it's just amazing)
+ Looting (items are diverse, although at a certain point you may find some items, or even a particular item, that can't be surpassed by any other)

Questionable:
? Main and side quests are good but repetitive.
? I value games that are fun to replay over and over again, be it a multiplayer or an awesome singleplayer campaign. I doubt that this game (at least right now) belongs to such a category. I know that developers add new regimes and may add something else in the future, so let's see what happens. It would be disappointing if that was the final product.

Negative sides:
- Price - After completing the overly repetetive campaign and most of the side quests there seems to be nothing else to do, making me wonder if the game is worth what it's asked for. Keeping in mind that there is a mobile version of the game with an appropriate price I feel that I overpayed.

The game definitely promises pleasant experience, although first impressions might promise even more. I have played 5 hours straight while congratulating developers in my head. After playing 9 hours, the interest is lost. The game is fun and not crude, but maybe new enemies/mobs, new quests, more diverse map and fighting mechanic, as well as co-op would make the game even better. I am willing to change my opinion as soon as the game is enriched.

38403846.review:
Cat Quest ist einfach genial - weil es genial einfach ist. 
Keine riesigen Skilltrees, Dutzende Werte oder anderen komplizierten oder strategisch tiefgründigen Mechanismen. Hier ist einfach nur Spaß und Entspannung angesagt.
Die Grafik ist sehr süß, das Kampfsystem mit der Mischung aus Magie und Nahkampf macht tierisch Spaß und die Story ist spannend und voller (albernem) Humor. 
Ja, Cat Quest hat es definitiv in die Liste meiner Lieblingsspiele geschafft und ich empfehle es 100% weiter. Der Vollpreis ist hier mehr als fair für dieses liebevoll gestaltete Spiel, in dem man viele, viele Stunden verbringen kann. Durch das neue Pro-System macht auch ein erneutes Durchspielen durchaus Sinn, da es verschiedene Herausforderungen gibt, auf die man seinen Spielstil einstellen und anpassen muss.
Ich hoffe wirklich sehr, dass es in naher Zukunft eine Fortsetzung geben wird - und wer sich "Gentlebros" nennt, der wird einer Dame ja wohl keinen Wunsch abschlagen, oder? ;)

38181773.review:
뭐랄까 모바일 게임을 컴퓨터로 하는 듯한 느낌. 10000원짜리 게임으로는 적절하다 생각한다. 

그래픽은 카툰식으로 깔끔하다. 다만 쳐다보는 방향은 4가지로 고정. 
게임 플레이는 고양이로 열심히 마법 날리고 검으로 때려잡으면서 구르기로 피하는 액션 인디 게임. 
레벨 스케일링이 나름 잘 되어있어서 서브퀘스트만 다 하면 노가다는 따로 필요 없다. 
스토리도 최후반부는 좋았다만 결말자체는 그냥저냥. 

아쉬웠던 점은: 1. 공격은 마우스로만 가능한데 wsad + 1234로 마법  + 스페이스로 구르기라 살짝 힘들었다. 마우스 커서 이동이 필요 없는 관계로 키보드에 공격키 줬으면 아무 문제가 없었을텐데 아쉬운 부분. 키 바인딩 수정도 불가능하다.
2. 동굴에 비밀길 너무 많음. 환상 서유기에서 싫었던 점이기도 한데 숨겨진 길은 한 두 개여야지 두 개 걸러 하나에는 숨겨진 길이 있다는 것이 별로였다.
3. Mew Game의 같은 행동 반복하게 하기. 결과가 달라지지 않는 것을 다시 하는 것은 전혀 즐겁지 않다.

여담이다만 게임하면서 너무 모바일 같아서 여기에 하루에 목숨 제한 두고 일부러 레벨 스케일링 꼬아서 현질로 무기 안 사면 못 깨게 만들었다면 끔찍했을 거란 생각이 계속 들더라...

38088932.review:
I paid $11 for 9 hours of gameplay, and it was fun. This includes the main story and all acheivements you can get without playing Mew Game or New Game+.

Replayability? I don't think so. The game is simple, and it accomplishes a satisfying hack-and-slash wannabe ARPG experience, but if you don't like watching a movie more than once, you won't like playing this game more than once.

I saw what there is to see, I did what there was to do, I opened all of the chests, I beat the normal game, and I'm done.

A lot of the game is blatantly "go clear this dungeon", and it almost makes fun of itself for that. "Another fetch quest..." "Make sure you /defeat all monsters inside/ so we can search for the item!" Blah Blah.

The loots are all random, both in item and sheer level power, except for three legendary items. Some items are just purely worse than others. In the normal game, the level progression makes certain stats like extra HP useless on items. Overall, I would say I had a lot of garbage and only rarely switched what I was using. The equipment that lowers one stat and increases another just isn't worth using for the most part in the normal game where you see it first.

I would say the game is a great format for bigger ideas, like co-op multiplayer and deeper level and item experiences, and I look forward to any similar future releases from this company that decide to go that route.

It was fun. I enjoyed the game. That's good enough.

38085594.review:
Cat Quest, beside I enjoyed the gameplay of the game, I got quite deceptioned during the end of It, and I'll try to explain why on this review.

To begin with, this game has something that Isn't found on other games like Legend of Zelda, a fun combat, not only that, but there is also a leveling system in the game, which doesn't really limit you in the gameplay, the level only being a indicator of how challenging the foes of that cave/area are, so you will pay more attention to the enemies on the screen than on your level number, and yes, that matters.

Talking about leveling, It's not really that hard to progress, you can either do quests or grind the caves or monsters on field to level up the character, and aswell get some golds to buy gear upgrades and spell upgrades.
The diversity of gears you can find in the game is great, and you notice that each set is different from each other, beside some of them seems worthless to use, like the Ninja set, whose benefits I don't see, and the Crappy set, which obviously is worthless, unless you want to increase the challenge during the gameplay.

The world map is big, not only is big, but the only transitions you have is in and out of caves, meaning that there are no loadscreens at all. And you can explore every part of the world, as soon as It's possible for you to reach them.

The skills are also very useful, and have different effects and uses, which may aid you during the gameplay, even If you doesn't play as a mage.

The quests of the game have a interesting plot, though, includding the side quest, I, myself, enjoyed more the side quests than the main quest, looked like as If I were playing Final Fantasy III again, but with cats and hack n slash gameplay.
Beside the lots of cat puns are quite...

Those are the good sides of the game, now the bad sides.

First, the chests inside the dungeons doesn't respawn, meaning that If you want to upgrade your gears, you have to buy new chests from the Blacksmith, or try finding chests on other dungeons you didn't explored yet.

Talking about chests, almost every chest in the game have a RNG of which gear you can get, the bad is that It might also give you a item you have already maxed the level, meaning that you wasted a chest away.

Buying new chests from the blacksmith is the most tedious thing ever, but isn't as tedious as training Enchanting on Skyrim, you have to do a ritual to buy the chests, no matter what chest It is, press E on the chest to trigger a dialogue with Kit asking If you want to buy the item, press Yes, then a chest appears on the screen, you have to wait a little while before the E appears so you can open the chest, press E, then the animation of opening the chest plays and after that appears the item you acquired. Now repeat that over and over until you either get what you want, or gets tired. It's boring and annoying!

The villain of the game is a [spoiler]weakling! You notice that since the beggining of the game, and If you keep doing side quests during your gameplay, you'll notice that he'll keep being a weakling even until the end game, everytime he spawns a clone, he kind of admits himself that he's a weakling, since his clones can be beaten with ease, If you master dodging the spells the he launches, you will end up laughing on how pathetic the boss is, and even more how he persists until the end the game on challenging the player.[/spoiler]

The monsters all have their own same behaviors, they either melee attacks, either have melee attack and casts, either casts, either melee attacks and casts two skills, either melee attack and casts 3 skills, well, just count how many cast prediction bars have under the enemy.

The cheapest fight I had in the game were [spoiler]against the Catulhu, using the melee It's almost impossible, since It used an AOE trap skill very often, so only using magic is able to defeat it, but since the player has so low number of mana, that means...[/spoiler]

[spoiler]There is also the fact that after unlocking water walking, you can right away unlock the Flight skill, since just by unlocking it, you can go get the Flight Skill quests right away. Beside water walking allows you to face enemies in the water, there is not much in the game that requires this, also, flying is faster, why would you walk, or even water walk when you can fly to your destination?[/spoiler]

And to finish, Spirry. Since the character has the personality of a door, Spirry talks for him, he's not that much as bad as the bag from Secret of Grindea, but I'd like to say something else to him at the end game, after beating the final boss.

Well, this is my review about the game, beside the game doesn't have really much, being that I beaten It in 90 summed minutes of gameplay, the game is quite conforting to play, and grinders will probably love It, even more since level cap goes beyond level 100, and If I remember well, there are level 200 dungeons, so either you be hardcore and try beating that dungeon underleveled, or grind 'till there.

You may also pick the set that matches mostly your gameplay, and try to level it up, there are new game plus and other things in the game, but right now I'm not going to attempt it, maybe in the future.

At first, I played the game ignoring the entire plot and stuff, but after seeying some funny situations, I begun reading the plot and It's quite funny, and most likelly full of refferences too, beside I saw some beggings in the game... And a promisse that If the game gets popular the plot might be expanded, which either means a new game update, dlc, or a new cat quest game.

Overall, the game is fun and worth playing.

Edit:. Well, after giving a closer look into the game, and also finding out Mew Game capabilities, duck Drakoth, duck Kit Cat's chests, and duck Spirry, this game is fun, It's worth playing, and when done playing, replay with Mew Game plus, If you want more challenge on the new gameplay, use the Stronger monsters modifier alongside the one which allows you to bring your levels and equipments with you.

Overly recommended! Even more since It's has replay value, and allows you to restart, while continuing your progression.

38076254.review:
Great game

I would say for the gamer who likes singleplayer fantasy medieval role playing games 

Yes this is a good game and a really nice one.
The controls are perfect like absolutely perfect and fluid for a real time conbat system using the mouse and wasd keys to swing your weapon in the desired direction is perfect with the fact that the arc and distance is consistence and perfect for hitting enemies. Even if the enemies do not get stunned they have a fair amount of time before they telegraph an attack again. 

You can see the outline of each attack before it happens requiring you to get out of the way and take your chance from the opening. With all the enemies present they have fair patterns with different solutions some easier than the others but there is nothing like leveling up to prepare for a challenging adversary if your not too skilled.

The spell system is perfect and satisfying with all of the spells having a purpose and suiting a play style using the RMB to select and execute the spell is really quick and i would love this to carry on to cat quest 2 and other games rather than moving a finger from your directional keys to hit a button which some people might have a problem with.

The combat is based on your skill level and really satisfying combined with the coincidence it is the right amount of quest to level up to a comfortable level to face anything that the game can throw at you from the recommended level from the quest on the main story so there is no pointless boring grinding but immersive adventuring of different places, dungeons and caves its really nice as they have made the experience system not too slow or fast but also once again perfect.

The storyline and art style is nice having combat on the overworld map instead of being taken to a individual fight screen for boring turn by turn fighting where you are not tested on skill in that case but here it speeds up encounters and put them always as a fun ordeal that you will face and there is no problems in running away from a fight you find difficult. 

Simplistic to a point where the player can adopt it really fast but fits a fine line of flow of not being too easy or being too hard. Both in the complexity of controls and difficulty of the game.

I would play this game over and over again but i wish that there is a way to reset the game to level one as mew mode can be challenging as it replaces enemies with boss types or harder ones with the old normal game enemies making it for a tougher experience it would be nice to have a reset feature for introducing the game.

What i do not agree is the weapons system as it is all based on luck of what you get instead of purchasing what you want in the game. The game's loot system upgrades older equipment by finding the same item in the chest you opened so its all based on luck and sometimes you might not find the thing you wanted due to your play style.

I wish there was more variety in the combat but it doesnt mean its solid and that is something that hopefully will be present in cat quest 2 that i will certainly buy.

With many positives that the game developers have done right and only one nitpick negative that can be overlooked as it doesnt affect gameplay with the price of the game now there is no harm in trying it and certainly it can burn many hours with fun filled entertainment while playing cat quest. Buy it

38069010.review:
Cat Quest is a super cute action-adventure game a la Zelda. There's a lot of fun, open-world exploration and just enough hidden stuff to find. The graphics and sound are top-notch -- actually, much, much better than I expected, given its modest price. I completed one whole do-everything-get-all-the-achievements playthrough in about 18.5 hours, which is pretty good value for about ten bucks. And, what can I say, it's an incredibly charming, lighthearted game. 

There are extra modes for replaying with more difficulty, if that's your bag (it's not mine), and about half the Steam achievements lie in beating the game on subsequent playthroughs.

The story is pretty light, and it's certainly not an RPG in the sense that there's really no choosing and playing a role. All the quests are pretty much linear, and there's no branching decisions. However, that's not the kind of game that I think it purports to be. What it is instead is good, clean fun, light, long enough to provide great gaming value but which doesn't overstay its welcome. 

Also, it never crashed once on my Mac (that's saying something) and the controller support is excellent -- I didn't touch either the keyboard or mouse at all for my entire time with the game.

I have zero complaints about this game, really.

38044580.review:
Cat Quest is an action RPG similar to Bastion and the Legend of Zelda series.

I love cats so this was a pleasure to play. Great graphics, nice storyline, and straightforward gameplay. It took me 5 hours to complete the main storyline which included completing several quest boards and dungeons to level up.

As other players have mentioned - the combat mechanics are limited. There are only a handful of enemies in the game and once you've faced them once you'll know how to deal with them the next time. The gear you collect is mostly useless (apart from fun to dress up your character with) and this includes the weapons. You're often given "Unique" items that you'll either never use or will use for 15 minutes until you find a better standard weapon.

The characters are fun and the mainstory arch has some nice twists and turns. Character development does allow players to play how the want to (more magic or more slashing). I found myself building a hybrid and spending all my gold on spells as the blacksmith didn't seem worth it.

Now that I've completed the main quest I will be unlocking the Steam achievements. If this requires me to play through the game again I probably won't do that.

Cat Quest was a fun and charming way to spend my Sunday afternoon. Thanks to the developers.

38023560.review:
To quote the many puns in the game, this game is pawsome. There are lots of cat puns. And if you don't like that then maybe you should consider a cat-scan ;). 

Cat Quest has a cute story that, while short, will throw you a few twists and turns. I called a few things ahead of time, but it did a decent job of still surprising me in the end. Well worth the playthrough, and if you speed right through it you can finish in about 6 hours. I did most of the side quests (59/62) and leveled up to 74 on my first playthrough and there was still plenty to do after i finished the game. Certain dungeons are listed as level 200 and if you want the achievement for dungeons you'll need put on your big boy britches and either play new game plus or challenge the games mew game plus (challenge mode basically).

Lots of replay value too. At least for me. Its cute and fun.

Pros: 
Really fun combat
Magic based on directional interface so calls for interesting gameplay
Quests are funny
Story is engaging
Save feature is fast
Dodge is responsive (with practice)
Magic can be OP (Get Purrserk early and use it on cooldown)

Cons:
Healing is tied to a weak magic or saving the game (only minimally annoying)
You dodge in the direction you're moving. If you aren't careful you can dodge into death. AKA get good
Upgrading magic can be expensive
Once you level up enough and get certain weapons the game feels too easy (there are harder challenges in mew game plus so this isn't a too big of a concern)
side quests require a lot of moving across the map and until you get flight this is super annoying to navigate

[h1]Cat Quest[/h1]

Das Spiel war zuerst als "nicht interessiert" markiert. Durch Zufall bin ich drauf gestoßen und hab es mir genauer angeschaut. UND ich muss sagen, das es sich gelohnt hat und noch lohnen wird. Ich bin nämlich noch nicht durch!

Allerdings kann man die Schwierigkeit durch die Ausrüstung wieder runter schrauben. Und das hin und her laufen wird auch irgendwann etwas müde (edit: ich kann jetzt fliegen! I bought this game thinking it might be just a cute gimmick for a few hours for my stream.  When I started playing the first thing I noticed was the music in the main menu...it was great.  Then I went into the game and it actually had a decent story so far.  The artwork is amazing and the combat is actually pretty decent featuring rolling as the form of damage prevention.  I love the humor in this game as well (SO MANY PUNS!!!).  I feel this game needs to be played if nothing else to support people who know what they want to make and do it well, it is truely Pawsome.  

TL:DR

Pawsitives--

++Great Aesthetics
++Great Music
++Great Humor (if you like puns)

+Decent Combat
+Decent Story
+Decent Loot

-No Rebindable Keys
-Resolution Settings (Seems limited to 1920x1080 but more options might just be hidden from me).
-Experience system
I feel the experience you get makes the game go a bit too fast, leaving you to do the quests you missed at a higher level than intended (too much experience gained).

Would highly recommend.

37937183.review:
This game is nice-looking, fun and I'd like to recommend it. But I just can't. 

First of all, I like APRGs like Diablo, Torchlight, Path to Exile, Titan Quest, Grim Dawn, you name it. The thing is, Cat Quest has different controls. While in most ARPGs you move and perfroms base attack with left mouse button, in Cat Quest you still  perform base attack with left mouse button, while you move with WASD. That changes a lot, though skills are traditionally binded to 1-2-3-4 keys. Have you ever tried to move with WASD, use your skills with 1-2-3-4 and base attack with left mouse button at the same time? My advise: do not try to. 

There is second option, though. Skills can be used with right mouse button. You click with right mouse button, choose a skill from dropdown menu and use it. I have to say, this is more convenient, than the first option, but it makes game less real-time and more turn-based. 

I have to say, I had similar problems in Hand of Fate, but in that case I just reassigned skill keys to my additional mouse buttons and played that way. Cat Quest, hovewer, does not have Controls menu at all. So you just can't reassign controls. 

I wish the developers do something about controls and in this case, I'm willing to try the game again, and perhaps, change my review.

I feel that the cheeky cat puns over and over, and the censorsed violence is revoked by the fact that at one point you literally complete a pentagram demonic summoning seance.  I really thought, going into this game, that it was a nice family friendly game as I feel it was marketed.  It is however a great game and well worth the money. 37846247.review:
这是一款让人觉得舒服的游戏。自由度不算很高，难度可以自行控制，如果觉得难了，就去完成支线任务升级。
游戏节奏感很强，不仅是打击的节奏，还包括战斗的节奏，其实也就是敌人的攻击模式相对单调了。相对移动版，这个版本有闪避技能，我认为这个才是这款游戏战斗部分的精髓，玩起来才会有节奏感，所以推荐大家一定要下steam版。
相对故事较为简单，收集物也较少，一定程度上满足了收集爱好者又不会让人觉得漫长。
当然我最满意的就是其萌系的设计。q版的小猫，武器也是服装，省去了时装之类的东西，建筑背景也很q，包括地图也给人萌萌的感觉，整个游戏的节奏可快可慢，及时游戏通关了也可以进去慢慢欣赏到处闲逛。
真心希望后续还能有更新，补充一些支线任务，增加一些武器收集，让这个游戏可以继续。

37224122.review:
Cat Quest ist jedem zu empfehlen der Katzen mag, ein freundliches Spiel zum abschalten sucht und sich über - teilweise "flache"- Katzen-Wortspiele amüsieren kann.

Das Spiel wirkt bunt und lädt zum entdecken ein. Aber vorsicht! Überall lauern Gefahren und Herausforderungen für unseren Abenteurer. Während man sich die Gegner vornimmt und die Dungeons leert levelt man auf und füllt seine Tasche mit Rüstungen und Waffen. Für jeden Spieltypen, egal ob Magier oder Tank, ist das passende Set dabei.

Aber neben den fiesen Gestalten gibt es auch allerhand Katzen in Felingard die Hilfe benötigen. An den Questboards, die es in jeder Ansiedlung gibt, finden sich aufeinander aufbauende Aufträge, die manchmal tragische, lustige und verwirrende Quests enthalten. Manche sind einfach auch so absurd bzw so mit Wortspielen randvoll zugepackt, dass man einfach lachen muss.

Die Dialoge sind leichtherzig und einladend gestaltet. Mit wenig Textzeilen wird das nötige erzählt, aber gleichzeitig auch viel Atmosphäre geschaffen.

Generell ist das schöne an Cat Quest auch, dass es relativ simpel für ein RPG ist - kein Fähigkeitensystem, kein überladenes Tränke- und Rüstungswirrwarr. "Nur" ein paar Zaubersprüche die man verbessern kann und eine überschaubare Anzahl von Waffen und Rüstungsteilen. 
Hier ist man wirklich mehr mit entdecken und questen beschäftigt, anstatt stundenlang die beste Kombi aus tausenden zu finden. 

Abschließend bleibt noch zu sagen wer einigermaßen gut englisch verstehen/lesen kann, dem empfehle ich das Spiel auf englisch zu spielen damit man keine Wortspiele verpasst! :D

Klare Kaufempfehlung!

A casual and fun action RPG, with a cute art style (especially the stylistic world map).

The game itself is pretty simplistic - you wander the land completing fetch quests for its denizens and delving into simple dungeons. The combat is composed of attacking and dodging, with different magical abilities varied enough to keep things interesting.

The systems in place don't quite have the longevity to last for the 8 hours I needed to 100% the game, but otherwise Cat Quest respects your time. The story is simple but cute, with some amusing side characters.

A fun, light game with heart that could benefit from some more depth or variety in quest design and combat.

36554151.review:
One of the few games I have paid full price for. I binged the game in one 7 hour sitting, which is uncharacteristic for me.

Pros:
* Simplified gameplay, in a good way: The only stats are armor, health, attack, and magic.
* Satisfying combat loop: Dodge, attack, cast magic attacks (with no cooldown).
* No items to juggle: Regain mana by attacking, regain health by casting heal.
* Great sense of humor: Memes, but clever about it.

Cons:
* Story feels unfinished: An interesting premise with a lot for the player to figure out, but there were some loose ends by the time the game ends. I kept hunting for a new Secret Dungeon to beat in order to explore more of the lore.
* Gets a bit repetitive towards the end: White the combat loop is satisfying, eventually you're just fighting the same variants of enemies with more health.

Worth the price! I hope they expand the game in the future.

36526649.review:
Cat Quest is a rather casual action/adventure RPG. I ended up completing the whole game, including all of the side quests and getting all of the equipment (though a certain bug required extra time to get a specific item). But even though I did all of that, I would say that the game probably should not be "Overwhelmingly Positive," which owes to Steam's inability to review in ways other than simply "Good or Bad." I do not think that the graphics or game's sense of humor should save itself from its bigger flaws.

The graphics for the game are pretty nice, though I'd say a majority of the world looks pretty similar in style until later on, with a few outskirts being drastically different than the rest, including some funny easter egg areas. The music and sound never gave me any issues (except for the cat "meow"-ing when hit in combat sometimes, which bothered me for some reason).

But I would say that the story and gameplay are the imbalanced parts of the game. The story, as a whole, is a little funny at times, but basically boils down to "Here's some main villain out of nowhere; follow him." And more than half of the side quests redirect to this main villain again, though it's usually towards the end of quest chains going "He is the reason this happened!" There are some places where the main storyline gets a little weird, and makes you think of where it will go... But by the end of the game, it sort of falls away and ends really quickly, like you just ran off of a cliff. Not much is resolved, and the interesting parts of the storyline remain as hidden references. My reaction to the end was "Huh? That's it?"

I would say that the side quests had more fun with their mini-stories than the main storyline itself did. There's a lot of humor in them, of course, with many puns and jokes. Some people might find it off-putting, but I enjoyed that aspect for the most part.

For the gameplay, however, it's a simple system. You gain experience and gold. You level up. You swing weapons, dodge, blast magic, and collect equipment. You run around for quests. (Actually, running back and forth across the map is probably most of your gameplay time until you unlock a new movement ability.) This is pretty much "Any RPG Experience Ever (TM)" in the simplest terms. The gameplay is action-oriented and you get to mostly explore as you want, so you're not forced following certain quests the whole time. You can find higher-leveled side quests and try them earlier on, for instance, like I did, instead of following early quests or the main storyline.

But the mechanics used for exploration and combat are the downside. If you play the game consistently without many breaks, you should probably find that the game is overly easy, becomes repetitive, and lacks repeatability. If you're really bad at dodging the enemies, then you might find it difficult for some reason. There are maybe between 20 to 30 types of enemies in the game, but there's only about 6 ways the enemies can attack you. Each enemy only follows similar attack sets for the most part, with slightly altered ranges and directions. Thus, the combat boils down to "Dodge this way, attack, wait, dodge that way, attack, wait" ad infinitum.

Most of the equipment in the game is unnecessary, and you will probably ignore a lot of what you come across. Even the spells you acquire (while some are useful in certain corridors) for the most part are not needed. In fact, you can probably complete the game with just the Fire spell you unlock near the very beginning. While the quest stories are a little fun, all of them pretty much resolve with clearing out a dungeon or destroying a group of enemies on the overworld, hence repetitive combat is the main key point.

About the only way for the game to change "difficulty" is to buff enemies, debuff equipment, or for you to fight high-level things as a weakling. All of these methods are essentially artificial difficulty and do not require any extra strategy or change in gameplay, for the most part, and only would make the game more grind-like. Ironically, the developers are releasing "Mew Game" as a New Game Plus format that has modifiers to do the above, such as prevent usage of armor or weapons, or limit yourself to Level 1 for the whole game. It's quite ridiculous actually, after I tested around with it a bit. I am unsure why some people would enjoy it, considering all it does is make a battle take longer even though you're still performing the exact same actions you did the first time around.

As said earlier, I think a good amount of positive reviews simply think humor and charm cover for the game's rating, while I think it definitely has some big design issues.

Cat Quest is a very fun, engaging and simple RPG. Being simple isn't bad though, as it works for the gameplay. You attack, roll and cast magic. That's it.
Still, there are many dungeons to clear, many (side) quests to complete and a ton of equipment to collect and upgrade.
The dialog is witty, the story is charming and the characters (or should I say charcaters?) are likable.
One minor complaint is that the main story is rather short, but there's more than enough extra stuff to keep you entertained for a few hours.
Recommended to fans of RPG's and cats :3

<Update 26 November 2017>
The newly added 'Mew Game' mode provides even more challenges for those of you who want to push themselves to the limits. With unique armor to earn and even more achievements, this extra content is most definitely the cat's meow ;)

36298092.review:
I've played Cat Quest for 15 hours or so and I must say I immensely enjoyed it. Did not expect the game to be as fun as it actually is, I foresaw a shallow indie RPG and got something really fun with a lot of charm! Combat is engaging, progression is quite complex and the story/atomosphere/art style are all amazing.

Some design input: 

At the very beginning when I started playing and was about 1 hour into the game, I was utterly immersed and then... I started doing all the side quests. What I found vaguely irritating (less so at the later stages of the game due to certain gameplay mechanics) was that each hub had a questline with progressively higher level requirements. This meant that you could not complete storyline A and then move onto the next hub with a different questline. 

From my point of view, this has two major disadvantages: first of all, I'd much rather experience one story as a whole and complete it without initiating another narratives at the same time. It just feels disruptive when you're doing multiple questlines concurrently and sometimes one might actually forget what the quest he/she was on is about. Secondly, you have to constantly move between different hubs which can get quite tedious and boring and also it juts artificially lengthens the game which is not a good thing in my opinion.

I just think that the player experience would be much better if the hubs were designed in a somewhat different manner:

instead of having Hub A with quests for levels 1, 4, 9 > Hub B with 2, 5, 10 > Hub C with 3, 6, 13 the dispersion should look something more like the following: Hub A with 1, 2, 3 > Hub B with 4, 6, 7 > Hub C with 5, 8, 9.

Anomalies in level requirement curve should be much rarer.
​
Of course this is purely subjective and someone might not prefer the latter, just my two cents. 

The game is deceptively simple and has a lot of depth behind it which I really love. With that being said, while I really appreciate any types of 'secrets' if you will in all kinds of games (huge fan of zelda and the souls series) and a design philosophy which doesn't give everything to the player on a silver platter, some of the 'secrets' that were put in Cat Quest might be game breaking to a certain degree. 

To give you some examples, dungeons such as the founder cave or the hidden level 99 cave can be exploited to easily farm gold and experience with A MUCH HIGHER efficiency than any other method in the game. When you introduce such areas, monsters there should probably not be able to respawn after being killed. 

That way discovering these areas will still feel rewarding but consequently players won't be able to exploit them and at the same time will avoid ruining the game for themselves (other content becomes trivial after completing the said dungeons multiple times and farming the same spot repeatedly is really not fun).

The spell/ability system is somewhat luckluster imo or rather the foundation for it is good but the spells themselves need some tweaking/balancing. The very first one you get (the AoE circle) along with +% DMG that you get later on are clearly the best choices and shun other potential fun builds. 

Also, Willpower and Faith both need a major nerf since they render all the other much cooler looking equipment useless.  ^^ Lets us assume that you can only get Faith and Willpower at the very end of the game without making other content trivial. These items still outshine all the others though. Even then, that should not be the case in my opinion. I think it's much more interesting if you have a lot of varied gear and every single set is somewhat better in a different area. 

The game is quite short which is fine given its pricing but more importantly since I think it could get monotonous if it were a lengthy title. As I have already said, the combat is engaging and fun BUT you're basically doing the same thing over and over again. What this game could use is some additional minor twists in gameplay from time to time, perhaps logical puzzles of some sort that require you to interact with environment in a certain pattern? 

Cat Quest has a lot of potential I think and while it is already an amazing game, in my humble opinion it could benefit a lot from replayable 'end game' content. I wonder if the developers thought about future systems to implement? How about something along the lines of greater rifts as seen in Diablo. 

I'd suggest adding procedurally generated dungeons with randomized monsters that get progressively harder and scale endlessly. You could call them 'dragonblood challenges', an ancient arena of sorts that the past dragonblood used to test their might. :) 

You could even add an in-game leaderboard of some kind that would allow the players to compare their dragonblood challenge scores though I suppose that might be slightly trickier to implement.

36271713.review: Don't see why this has a 95%+ rating. The game has obvious charm and the combat system is well-put together albeit simple. For an rpg, it has some major flaws though. 36249367.review:
Что можно сказать об игре, внешне она выглядит замечательно, и кот тут прикольный.
На этом все плюсы заканчиваются.

Сначала вам будет все интересно. Вам покажется что тут неплохая боевка, с сундуков падают шмотки, можно прокачивать какие-то магии, в деревнях есть квесты.. Но поиграв пару часов вы поймете, что всё, что может предложить игра вы уже попробовали.

Боевая система такая: подходим к мобу, отходим сразу же, снова подходим и бьем, дальше все покругу, к середине игры будет уже напрягать.

Квесты они все однотипные, и даже бить нужно одинаковых мобов. Разновидность мобов, можно пересчитать по пальцам. Подземелья почти все одинаковые, лишь пара из них уникальна. 

Куча всякого шмота, вообще как по мне бесполезная вещь. Лишь для ачивки открыть 66 шмоток.

И так вы проиграли 2 часа, прокачали примерно 40 уровень, узнали уже все что только можно в игре, зачистили половину подземелий. А дальше мучаетесь и думаете, скорей бы уже прокачать 99 уровень, зачистить все что осталось и наконец закончить эту игру.

Я бы не рекомендовал данную игру по текущей цене, только по скидке в 50%.

[h1]Inicio[/h1]

Cat Quest es ARPG(Action Rol Play Game) desarollado por Gentelbros.
Este el 1er juego de ellos que esta en steam(tecnicamente el segundo pero fue una colaboracion)
Los ARPG me pasan por desapercibido no son malos(en mi opinion) solo no me interesan. Pero este juego entra en el top 10 mejores juegos(Puede ser por mi inesperiencia,ya que no he jugado muchos juegos si son distitos). Me encanta Cat Quest, Me gustan las mecanicas,su humor,su historia(por mas clishe que sea),Me parece un juego necesario para tu colecion de juegos.
Sin alargar mas vamos a analizar!(bueno yo voy a escribir,pero queda mejor ☻)

[h1]Jugabilidad[/h1]

Cat Quest tiene la MEJOR jugabilidad que he probado(Para los ARPG). Mira te explico brevemente: Golpeas con click isquierdo, te mueves con W,A,S,D,haces magia con 1,2,3,4, esquivas con Espacio.La Inteligencia artificial es buena, no es mala es lo justo.

[h1]Historia[/h1]

Es un cliche con humor.Tiene su giro pero ñe. Pero! las historias secundarias son buenas.

[h1]Musica[/h1]

Es ambiental, no es Perfeccion(OneShot) es buena, ambienta el nivel.

[h1]Bugs[/h1]

NO hay bugs(al menos no he visto ninguno)

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

Cat Quest es un exelente ARPG. Jugabilidad exelente,historia decente,buen humor,etc
Nota Final = 9.75

게임 스토리를 대략 요약하자면, 여동생을 잃은 냥이오빠가 여동생을 찾기 위해 힘을 길러가며 여정을 떠나는 내용입니다.

1. 귀여운 캐릭터

   퀘스트던전도 추천 레벨보다 낮아도 충분히 깰수 있구요

아기자기한 게임을 좋아하는 여성분들이나 몇시간 귀여운 고양이 보면서 힐링하고 싶으신 분들께 강추합니다~

Short, sweet and to the point. Cat Quest doesn't try to be anything other than what it is, and that is what makes it great. 

Don't expect any ground-breaking innovation or twists and turns, but if you enjoy a dodge-heavy combat with a decent layer of spell mechanics and upgrades, not to mention the im-paws-ibly corny, but endearing cat puns, this is a game for you.

35716959.review:
Cat Quest is an action rpg where you play as a cat who collects items and fights enemies on a world map and underground caves.

Cat Quest is charming. It's easy to like it. Controls are good, graphics are easy to look and well done, there are lots of quests and items to get. Though no usable items what so ever. The only usable you have are your spells.

Basically you level up, gain more hp, attack and spell power from levels and items. Also items level up when you find a same item you already had.

What ever Cat Quest has is fun and nice but it doesn't have too many different enemies and the sound track is pretty short.

The same formula repeats over and over where you get a quest, walk where you're supposed to and then back. Sometimes you clear an underground cave and open 1+ chests. This might or might not bother you. To me it's kind of a problem but not big enough of a problem that I'd stop playing. 

Cat Quest plusses:

+ very charming world and characters
+ fun music and graphics
+ simple and fun to play
+ lots of quests and items

Cat Quest minuses:

- it does get repeating pretty fast, it repeats the same formula for all the quests with very little variation
- not too many different enemies, gets repeating

Final words:

Cat Quest isn't my favourite game at all but it might be one of my favourites. Right now I'm okay how it is but I can't recommend it to everyone. At this price you need to like the game genre and the style of the game.

Personally I'm on the edge if I regret buying the game at full price. I suppose I do not but I'd hesitate buying it again without a discount.

At full price:  8- / 10

At half price: 8½ / 10

35583130.review:
Cat Quest est un petit rpg indépendant, frais et sans prise de tête. Vous évoluerez dans un monde ouvert, représenté sous forme de carte (détail esthétique suffisamment original pour être souligné). En un peu moins de 10h de jeu, vous aurez le temps de remplir tout un tas de quêtes, d'explorer quantité de mini-donjons aux trésors alléchants ou tout simplement de dégomer quelques mobs se dressant malencontreusement sur votre passage. 

La prise en main est rapide, facile. Et il faut dire qu'on y prend rapidement goût, alternant entre coups d'épée, sorts de zone et roulades. Un petit côté addictif et décontractant.
En parlant de magie, ces sorts ne feront pas l'objet d'arbres à compétences. Il suffira de vous rendre chez un mage afin de débloquer et upgrader le sort de votre choix (via une certaine somme de POs). Quant au stuff, ce dernier est lootable en donjon, par l'intermédiaire de quêtes ou chez la forgeronne qui vend ses propres coffres. Notons que si vous trouvez le même équipement, ses stats augmenteront. 

Que dire d'autre ? Malgré une ambiance bon enfant, quelques jeux de mots... on déplorera peut-être une histoire un peu trop classique et une durée de vie un poil trop courte (quelques quêtes supplémentaires n'auraient pas été de refus). Bien que ce choix soit entièrement assumé par les devs, on reste un peu sur sa faim. 

Néanmoins, si vous voulez souffler entre deux jeux particulièrement éprouvants ou tout simplement vous amuser sans difficulté, Cat Quest pourrait bien être ce qu'il vous faut.

35579285.review: Jogo viciante cheio de trocadilhos e de referencias. Otimo jogo. Melhor do que eu esperava

35562894.review: It's im-paws-ible not to like this game!

35560306.review:
[h1][b]Moin Moin![/b][/h1]
Herzlich Willkommen zu meiner kleinen Review über [b]Cat Quest[/b] von [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198340996474]The Gentlebros[/url]!

[h1]Allgemein[/h1]
Wer auf der Suche nach einem tollen, kindgerechten und nicht allzu schweren Singleplayer-Indie-Rollenspiel (RPG) ist, der liegt mit [b]Cat Quest[/b] genau richtig.
Mir stach das Spiel durch seinen ulkig-knuffigen Comic-Stil ins Auge und es glänzte im späteren Verlauf durch seine intuitive und schnell zu erlernende Steuerung sowie dem runden Gameplay. Auch der orchestralisch angehauchte Soundtrack passt wie der Hintern auf einen Eimer – einfach klasse! 
Die Quests gehen leicht von der Hand, wiederholen sich im Laufe der Zeit doch leider immer wieder in ihrer Art: suche [i]diesen[/i] Gegenstand, töte [i]diese(s)[/i] Monster – was auf Dauer doch recht monoton wirkt. Während dem Verfolgen der Hauptstory und dem Erledigen der Nebenmissionen viel dieses jedoch nicht allzu stark auf. Erst nach circa 7,5 Spielstunden und dem Abschließen der Hauptstory war zum Erreichen sämtlicher Erfolge das [i]Grinden[/i] angesagt, um das Level 99 (nach oben gibt’s keine Grenze!) zu erreichen und noch fehlende Items für das Arsenal finden zu können. Aber auch hier wird einem der Weg durch das Bestreiten der 52 Dungeons erleichtert… Nach 10 Spielstunden waren dann auch alle Geheimnisse gelüftet, Gegenstände gesammelt, Nebenmissionen erfüllt und Errungenschaften erreicht. Für den Preis [i](EUR 12,99)[/i] kann man einfach nicht meckern! Ein grandioses Spiel auch für Zwischendurch auf Grund der häufigen Möglichkeit des Speicherns und der Kürze der Aufgaben…

[h1]Andere Plattformen[/h1]
Das Spiel [i]Cat Quest[/i] ist auch für [url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/cat-quest/id1148385289?mt=8]iOS[/url] [i](USD 4,99) [/i] und [url=https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.thegentlebros.catquest&hl=de]Android[/url]-Geräte [i](EUR 5,49)[/i] im jeweiligen Store gegen einen geringen Obolus verfügbar! Außerdem sind Versionen für die PlayStation 4 (10.11.2017) und die Nintendo Switch angekündigt. [url=http://www.mediamarkt.de/de/product/_cat-quest-rollenspiel-playstation-4-2336249.html?ga_query=cat%20quest]Hier[/url] kann man bereits eine Version für die PS4 [i](EUR 19,99)[/i] vorbestellen – günstiger als bei Ama**n!

[table]
[tr]
[td][h1]Pro[/h1][/td]
[td][h1]Contra[/h1][/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
[td][list]
[*] 52 Dungeons
[*] 62 Nebenmissionen
[*] große Item-Vielfalt
[*] relativ lange Hauptstory
[*] versteckte und zu entdeckende Orte
[*] lustige Anekdoten zu den Charakteren im Spiel (ausschließlich Katzen)
[*] originell geschriebene Quests
[*] Steuerung per Maus/Tastatur oder einem Gamepad
[*] für Mobilgeräte bereits separat erhältlich
[*] keine Level-Grenze (erleichtert das Spiel im späteren Verlauf)
[*] keine Ladezeiten im Spiel
[*] Steam-Errungenschaften
[*] wohltuende Soundeffekte beim Sammeln von Gold, Erfahrung, Abschließen von Quests, Finden von Ausrüstungsgegenständen oder gar dem Level-Aufstieg...
[/list][/td]
[td][list]
[*] wenige Quest-Variationen
[*] unnötig viel Gold-Sammeln zum Kauf von Ausrüstungs-Kisten (zum Erreichen eines Erfolge)
[*] bisher keinen Wiederspielwert
[/list][/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

[code]
[h1]Verbesserungsvorschläge (für einen evtl. Nachfolger)[/h1]
…an das Entwickler-Team: 
[list]
[*]Crafting-System zum gezielten Verbessern von Ausrüstung bzw. dem Herstellen von Tränken (Potions)
[*] Fähigkeiten der individuellen Helden implementieren
[*] Charakter-Individualisierung bzw. Geschlechterwahl
[*] Speicherslots (3 Stück)
[*] Vielfältigkeit in den Quests
[*] ggf. 2 oder 3 Schwierigkeitsgrade
[*] weitere Steam-Errungenschaften
[*] Multiplayer-Modus (Koop)
[*] Bitte macht weiterhin solche tolle Spiele und auf jeden Fall einen Nachfolger!!!
[/list]
[/code]

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
[b]Cat Quest[/b] bedarf eigentlich viel mehr Public Relations, um sich selber gerecht zu werden. Keine Minute habe ich den Kauf bereut und voraussichtlich werde ich das Spiel für die PlayStation 4 ebenfalls erwerben! Es ist einfach jeden Cent wert! Wer sich nach der Review immer noch nicht sicher ist, ob er sich das Spiel zulegen soll, der sollte wenigstens die Demo-Version von der Shop-Seite ausprobieren!

[code]
[h1]Tipp![/h1]
Wer der englischen Sprache mächtig ist, der kann sich ja mal [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1117045262]diesen Guide[/url] zum Gold-Farmen durchlesen! Er ist doch recht hilfreich!
 
Alternativ kann ich ab Level 99 das Bezwingen der Monster in der [i]Einsamen Höhle[/i],
welche mittig in der Karte liegt, nahe legen. Dort bekommt man für einen ca. 20-sekündigen Lauf genau 2.018 Gold! Das sind rund 60.000 Gold in 10 Minuten bzw. 180.000 Gold in einer halben Stunde! Wem dann, so wie mir, nur noch ein Gegenstand im Inventar für den Ausrüstungs-Erfolg fehlt, der speichert vorher und geht anschließend zu Kit Katz und kauft dort die goldenen Truhen zu je 5.000 Goldstücke. Ist der gewünschte Gegenstand nicht dabei, lässt man sich in der Nähe von Monstern umhauen und man steigt wieder mit dem zuvor gespeichertem Goldbetrag ins Spiel ein und versucht sein Glück auf's Neue! :)
[/code]

[h1][i]Vielen Dank für’s Durchlesen und viel Spaß beim Zocken![/i]
[b]Game On! [/b][/h1]


[code]
[h1]13.11.2017 - Update[/h1]
[b]Cat Quest[/b] ist ab sofort auch für die Nintendo Switch für EUR 12,99 im Nintendo eShop erhältlich!
[/code]

35477083.review:
Что такое Cat Quest?
Во первых - это миленький котик рубящий всех монстров (блин они тут тоже милые, кроме всяких каменных, вот они монстры, а эти пушистики только на вид милашки :-3).
Во вторых очень очень очень странный сюжет (Сначала нам рассказывают историю этого мира , потом наш герой со своей сестрой плавают по морю, внезапно появляется плохой белый котик и крадет сестру героя ( кстати только в этом моменте у героев есть какая-либо мимика). Ему этого мало и он огромным лучом света взрывает корабль нашего котёнка. Этот белый кот телепортирует нашу (тоесть нашего героя) сестру и сам улетает. Наш герой смог спастись, и у него сзади на голове какой-то символ засиял ( боже после этого я ждал огромное количество сюжета, сценок и камаз крутых заданий, наивный), потом его выбросило на берег. Он очнулся и тут блин какой-то дух! Потом этот белый кот появляется и говорит что когда мы победим всех его дракончиков (он их призывает) тогда вернёт нам сестру) Дальше лучше не говорить, ибо тут сюжет с крутыми сценками кончается.
В третьих это подземелья. Тут их для маленького лвла штуки 3, не больше, все самое вкусное на 15 лвле.
В четвёртых тут есть и чу-чуть МаГиИ. Очень мало, но она есть. И у нас только несколько заклинаний. Мобы используют их, но с задержкой.
Итог : рекомендую? Пока да, возможно за 0.8 ч. игры я и не смог найти тот желанный сюжет, на который надеялся, но если любите котиков, 2D, огромные цены на шмот (валюта очень долго добывается), то эта игра для вас (так-что это игра для меня).
Можно поиграть как перерыв, от других игр. Но если хотите что-то супер хардкорное, это не для вас.
Итог2: 10 непонятных сюжетов /10, Over9000 милых котиков/10 и 1 главный герой который улыбается, даже если его подожгли.

杉果促销购入的游戏，四个多小时通关主线剧情，估计再花三四个小时就可以全成就。简单评价一下这款游戏吧。
优点：
[list]
    [*]画风清新可爱
    [*]操作简单易上手
    [*]作为一款ARPG游戏，打击感上佳
    [*]丰富的装备系统[spoiler] 开箱子系统[/spoiler]，而且有纸娃娃系统，换装可以实际显示到角色身上
    [*]开放世界的设定，给人探索的乐趣
[/list]
缺点：
[list]
    [*]怪物种类和支线任务的内容重复度很高，到后期比较让人疲劳
    [*]无论是主线还是支线，剧情都很薄弱
    [*]一路物理系莽通关，感觉很多魔法系的装备都是鸡肋
    [*]存在一些小bug
[/list]
总的来说，这是一款不错的2DARPG游戏，适合喜欢可爱画风和RPG的玩家，建议打折时入手。

Every little upgrade feels like it is actually doing something, item upgrades stack (ie. there are no duplicate items per se, each duplicate found boosts existing item).

The game took me about 9 hours to 100%, didn't feel like I was rushing either. So, yea, its a bit short. On the upside, it really didn't overstay it's welcome... Though, I wouldn't mind having some more content. 

Also, wouldn't mind if there were actual save slots. If you want to start a new game, it apparently overwrites previous one? I'd think this would be an issue to households with more than one player.

Overall: puntastic, plays fine, looks & sounds nice, supports apparently high refresh rates (seemed to run 120fps, and my screen is at 120Hz). Recommended.

35142569.review:
An absolutely delightful romp. Quite a balm in a game industry overrun with grimdark gorefests. If the Gentlebros hope to be the next SpryFox, I wish them godspeed in that noble endeavor. 

The cat theme is taken just far enough. The sound design is cute, and the music is just right, although not likely to be added to an audiophile playlist. Gameplay is smooth, and the art is fun to look at without looking cheap. It's an easy game, and death has no consequences besides sending you back to your last catnap location. Those seeking a challenge can choose to tackle higher level dangers or make use of nerfing equipment like the Crappy Set. No grinding is actually required except to get the Level 99 achievement, and even that took me only 15 minutes in the purpose-built leveling field. As for accessibility, the game lacks custom key bindings, but scores good marks on audio being unnecessary and color blind friendliness. 

10/10 Would Catventure again.

35131978.review:
It has cats, puns, and is an RPG. What more do you want in a game?

It's cute, fun, and has interesting lore. It's a forgiving game with death as you can save almost all of the time and you don't lose anything when you die. If you are struggling, go bash some monsters or hit up a few quests. The side quests are glorified fetch quests, but a lot of quests found in the same town are connected and have cute or parody stories. 

Geat for kids and adults.

34923501.review:
Cat Quest is a fun little game, but is a bit light on content for the price. I had the main quest beaten in 6 hours, and had every achievment done by 8 hours. I would definitely recommend waiting until it was on sale before buying.

That said, it was indeed a decent game. The controls are tight, the story is entertaining (albeit simple), the puns are decent (if occasionally over-used), and nothing ever felt like it was "unfair" to me. The only thing I disliked about it (other than how short it was) was that the devs made far too much use of hidden, unmarked paths in dungeons. It felt like I spent almost as much time walking into walls looking for secret paths as I did actually clearing dungeons. Not having to walk into walls constant would have probably shaved an hour off my playtime for the main quest, and upwards of two hours for the total playtime.

Still, it was a fun game, although I do recommend waiting until it's on sale. The content would be good for an $7.50 game, but at $13, it feels a bit short and light on content.

A short and simple game with backtracking and puns involving cats.

Now, I need to stress this: the puns are prevalent. Of all the written text in the game, there is a cat pun in at least 2/3 to 3/4 of it.
